title: D’ZETA Vintage-Modern Homepage at '/' with CTAs, earth-tone styling, and live counters

requirements.summary: Create a dedicated Homepage at '/' with the five required copy sections in the specified order (Hero, value grid, Social & Eco Impact + counters, Explore Our Space zones, footer).
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to '/' renders a homepage (not the Mini Museum page).
All five sections are present and appear in the order provided by the user.
Hero section includes 2 CTA buttons labeled exactly as provided in the draft.
Explore Our Space section lists: Quiet Room, Rooftop Sanctuary, Mini Garden, Heritage Museum, each with its provided description.

file_operations.description: Implement the new Homepage UI with the five required sections (in order) and the provided SSS-tier copy, including the Hero (headline/sub-headline/2 CTAs), 3-item value proposition grid, Social & Eco Impact section with a dedicated counter area placeholder, Explore Our Space (370 m²) zone list (Quiet Room, Rooftop Sanctuary, Mini Garden, Heritage Museum + their descriptions), and a professional footer block matching the provided footer copy.
Add the generated hero background image asset to be used by the Homepage hero section (wire it in via the Homepage component).
Add the generated D’ZETA logo asset to be used in the Homepage hero and/or footer branding (wire it in via the Homepage component).
Add the generated origin-map image asset to be used as a supporting visual within the Homepage (e.g., Social & Eco Impact section) without affecting existing Mini Museum behavior.

requirements.summary: Wire Homepage CTA buttons to existing TanStack Router routes for menu/ordering and exploration (museum and/or booking).
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the primary CTA takes the user to an existing route for ordering/menu (e.g., '/menu').
Clicking the secondary CTA takes the user to an existing route for exploring the space/storytelling (e.g., '/museum' or '/booking').
Routing uses TanStack Router navigation (no full page refresh).

file_operations.description: Use TanStack Router navigation to wire the primary CTA (label exactly: 'Pesan Sekarang & Pantau Antrean') to the existing Menu/ordering route (e.g., '/menu') and the secondary CTA (label exactly: 'Jelajahi Sudut D'ZETA') to an existing exploration route (prefer '/museum', or '/booking' if the draft implies booking). Ensure navigation is client-side (no full reload).

requirements.summary: Apply a Vintage Modern earth-tone style to the Homepage only, using Deep Forest Green / Terracotta / White Smoke accents and serif headings + sans body consistent with Tailwind fonts.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage headings visibly use the serif font family and body text uses the sans font family.
Homepage primary accents reflect earth-tone styling (green/terracotta) and remain readable in light mode.
No immutable frontend hook files are modified.

file_operations.description: Apply page-scoped Tailwind styling to achieve a 'Vintage Modern' look: ensure headings use Tailwind serif font classes and body uses sans classes; use earth-tone accents aligned with the existing theme tokens (primary/accent/secondary) to approximate Deep Forest Green, Terracotta, and White Smoke while keeping the changes limited to the Homepage.

requirements.summary: Make '/' the new Homepage across routing and navigation: update index route, fix BottomNav active state, and repoint Back to Home from '/museum' to '/'.
acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/App.tsx, the '/' route renders the new Homepage component.
BottomNav does not highlight “Museum” when the user is on '/'.
The Museum page remains accessible at '/museum' and behaves as before.

file_operations.description: Update the TanStack Router index route ('/') to render the new HomePage component while preserving the existing '/museum' route pointing to MiniMuseumPage.
Adjust active-state logic so that '/' is no longer treated as the Museum route; ensure Museum is only active on '/museum' (and its nested museum paths as appropriate).
Update both 'Back to Home' buttons to navigate to '/' instead of '/museum' using TanStack Router navigation.

requirements.summary: Implement the Homepage Live Counter area using existing metrics queries where possible, with graceful fallbacks and the three required counter labels.
acceptanceCriteria: Homepage shows a 3-item counter block with the exact labels from the draft.
If backend metrics queries fail or return empty, the homepage still renders without runtime errors and shows a sensible fallback state for the counters.
If metrics are available, the UI may display real values but must preserve the three draft counter categories/labels.

file_operations.description: Create a Homepage-specific Live Counter component that reads current metrics via existing React Query hooks (e.g., useGetCurrentMetrics) and renders exactly three counter items with the draft labels: '520+ Kilogram Limbah Terolah', '5 Kecamatan Mitra Lokal', and '100% Listrik Terjamin (Backup System)'. Implement defensive rendering so empty/error states display placeholders or the draft simulation values without breaking layout.
Integrate the HomeLiveCounters component into the 'The Social & Eco Impact' section and ensure the counter block layout remains stable in loading, empty, and error states.
